isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 MODEL - CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - Heated Fuel Filter

svcproc.title: Heated Fuel Filter
svcproc.para: Moving the key switch (452) to ignition position energizes the ignition relay (462-R1) and thus supplies power to circuits 13H and 16A, connector (102), circuits 16A and 16B, 15A resetting fuse B4, and circuit 31A to the fuel heater relay. This energizes the relay and allows power to flow from the mag switch through circuit 14B, 20A resetting fuse B7, a black wire, the relay N.O. contacts, and a red wire to the heated fuel filter (60). The ground path for the air dryer is a brown wire to the starter magnetic switch mounting bolt ground (J5). This keeps the fuel in the filter warm to prevent fuel "gel-up."
